alert.note: Alert for Greene; Perry; Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 1:25PM CST until January 03 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, Greene, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 124 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a slow moving line of thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If this band of heavy rain persists for a longer duration, a Flash Flood Warning may become necessary. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaumont, New Augusta, State Line, Buckatunna, Avera, Sand Hill, Bothwell, Byrd, Brewer, Piave, East Side, Hintonville, Smithtown, McSwain, Little Creek, Ferguson, Wingate, Old Avera, Knobtown and Mahned.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
